org.judal.storage.table

Interface Record

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable, Stored
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    JDORecord, SingleColumnRecord
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRecord, AbstractRecordBase, AbstractSingleColumnRecord, AbstractSingleNumberColumnRecord, JDOPersistenceCapable, SingleBigDecimalColumnRecord, SingleDateColumnRecord, SingleIntColumnRecord, SingleLongColumnRecord, SingleObjectColumnRecord, SingleStringColumnRecord

    public interface Record
extends Serializable, Stored

    Record interface.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sergio Montoro Ten

    • Method Detail

      • columns

        ColumnDef[] columns()

        Columns of the Record as given by a ViewDef, TableDef or FetchGroup.

        records of subclass MapRecord may contain more columns than the ones returned by calling this method in order to accommodate growing column families in column-oriented databases.
        Returns:
        ColumnDef[]
